entry.title: Russian firm sells off Armenia‚Äôs biggest telecoms provider

media:group.media:title: Russian firm sells off Armenia‚Äôs biggest telecoms provider
media:group.media:description:
üìçRussia‚Äôs largest telecommunications company sold off its Armenian subsidiary. The new Cyprus-based owner then said it plans to cede a 20% stake in the mobile network operator to the Armenian government. üìçOne of Armenia‚Äôs largest hydroelectric power plants came under new ownership two years ago. CivilNet broke the story this week.

media:group.media:title: #Mindfulleaders with Armen Kherlopian #shorts
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, we explore the life of Armen Kherlopian, Ph.D., a scientist, researcher, angel investor, and advisor to the board of several prominent corporations. We discuss the relevance of artificial intelligence, data sciences, and innovations for tomorrow. With a background in biomedical engineering and biophysics, we assess how Dr. Kherlopian entered the world of entrepreneurship, investments, and startups and how he makes sense of a world increasingly dependent on machine learning. Finally, we explore Dr. Kherlopian‚Äôs historical and family legacies from Aintab and Marash, which have been pivotal in his successes and mission to push boundaries in tech and sciences and contribute to the betterment of our world.

entry.title: Armenia to provide Azerbaijan with new landmine maps in ‚Äúconfidence-building step‚Äù

media:group.media:title: Armenia to provide Azerbaijan with new landmine maps in ‚Äúconfidence-building step‚Äù
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia has said it will provide Azerbaijan with more maps showing the locations of minefields in and around Nagorno-Karabakh as a ‚Äúconfidence-building step.‚Äù üìçControversy follows Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan's endorsement of changing the name of the ‚ÄúArmenian History‚Äù course to ‚Äúthe History of Armenia‚Äù. üìçThe Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Combine was again Armenia‚Äôs largest taxpayer in 2023, with the top 1000 companies in Armenia totaling over 4 billion dollars in taxes paid. üìçArticle on the implications of Azerbaijan‚Äôs credentials being rejected by the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/762900/european-human-rights-body-rejects-azerbaijans-delegation/ üìçArmenian entrepreneurs taking advantage of Estonian eVisa program: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/762883/estonian-e-residency-open-to-armenians/

entry.title: Azerbaijan extends Ruben Vardanyan‚Äôs pre-trial detention

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan extends Ruben Vardanyan‚Äôs pre-trial detention
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijan extended the pre-trial detention of Ruben Vardanyan, who briefly served as Karabakh‚Äôs premier and was detained by Azerbaijani forces last year amid the ethnic cleansing in Karabakh. üìçRussia‚Äôs top diplomat indicated the Kremlin plans to maintain its peacekeeping mission in Karabakh, despite the fact that the region has been depopulated of its Armenian population. üìçAzerbaijan ended cooperation with Europe‚Äôs oldest human rights body, hours before members voted to suspend the country, citing its actions in Karabakh, among others.
